STATEMENT OF THE Public Accounts OF THE NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES, FOR THE FINANCIAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 1892.

REGINA:
PRINTED BY R. B. GORDON, PRINTER TO THE GOVERNMENT OF THE NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES.
1892.
STATEMENT

OF THE

Public Accounts

OF THE

NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES,

FOR THE FINANCIAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30,

1892.

REGINA:

PRINTED BY R. B. GORDON, PRINTER TO THE GOVERNMENT OF THE NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES.

1892.
To His Honor the Lieutenant-Governor of the North-West Territories:

May it Please Your Honor,

I have the honor to submit a Statement of Receipts and Expenditure for the half-year ended December 31, 1891.

I have the honor to be,

Sir,

Your obedient Servant,

L. O. BOURGET,
Accountant, N.W. Government.

Regina, August 1st, 1892.

I have the honor to submit the Public Accounts of the North-West Territories for the half-year ended June 30, 1892.

I have the honor to be,

Sir,

Regina, August 1st, 1892.

AUDITOR'S REPORT.

ACCOUNTANT'S OFFICE,
NORTH-WEST GOVERNMENT,
REGINA, AUGUST 2ND, 1892.

Sir,

I have the honor to report, that in accordance with Your Honor's instructions, I have thoroughly examined the Books and Accounts of the North-West Government for the year ended June 1892, and found same correct.

I submit herewith a Statement in tabular form, of the Receipts and Expenditure of the North-West Government, leaving the balance of Local Revenue Fund to be $37,618.38, and the unexpended balance of transferred Dominion Fund $23,145.86, a total $60,764.24.

I have the honor to be,
Sir,
Your obedient servant,

HY. LEJEUNE,
Auditor.

His Honor the Lieutenant Governor,
North-West Territories, Regina.
